text: [Music]
one of the things you see much more
today is a managing people long distance
managing people who are not physically
near you managing people around the
world which means uh well several things
need to change we did a study called
Global Leadership the Next Generation
and we asked 200 specially selected high
potential leaders from around the world
this question how is the leader of the
future different than the leader of the
past or should they be different five
key variables came up variable number
one is something we call Global thinking
more and more the leader of the future
more than the past needs to think
globally not just domestically even if
you're managing a domestic business it
probably has Global interface Global
suppliers number two crosscultural
awareness in the past diversity in the
United States meant relationships with
women or African-Americans today
diversity means something completely
different which is a whole world to deal
with different religions cultures values
number three is something you touched on
technological Savvy the leader of the
future doesn't have to be a technologist
but needs to understand how technology
impacts their life and impacts their
business and the important core
technologies that are influenced their
success number four building alliances
and Partnerships in the past many
companies managed things from a line
point of view and didn't make alliances
and Partnerships great example is IBM in
the old days they had no no Partnerships
no alliances today they have alliances
and Partnerships every week so it's
totally different and the final variable
is called shared leadership not just
telling people what to do and how to do
it but asking listen and learn from
people all around you so those are the
five variables we saw as changing in the
New World
